Sentencas: Gadolinium doped barium cerate (BCG) electrolytes Ce0.8Gd0.2O1.9 + xBaO (x = 0.1 and 0.4) were prepared by wet chemical method for the use in solid oxide fuel cells operating at intermediate temperatures (600 degrees C to 800 degrees C).
Titulo: Structural and morphological analysis of barium cerate electrolyte for SOFC application

Sentencas: The as-prepared powder sample was calcined at 900 degrees C.
Titulo: Structural and morphological analysis of barium cerate electrolyte for SOFC application

Sentencas: The calcination temperature was identified using differential scanning calorimetry (DSC) analysis.
Titulo: Structural and morphological analysis of barium cerate electrolyte for SOFC application

Sentencas: The orthorhombic perovskite phase formation was confirmed by XRD analysis.
Titulo: Structural and morphological analysis of barium cerate electrolyte for SOFC application

Sentencas: From TEM results, the particle size was found to be about 32 nm which is in a good agreement with XRD results.
Titulo: Structural and morphological analysis of barium cerate electrolyte for SOFC application

Sentencas: BCG nanoparticles were formed at lower sintering temperature due to using microwave furnace.
Titulo: Structural and morphological analysis of barium cerate electrolyte for SOFC application

Sentencas: By reducing the sintering temperature of solid electrolyte through microwave technique, the percentage of barium loss was successfully reduced and the prepared electrolyte can be a good choice for solid oxide fuel cells operating at intermediate temperatures.
Titulo: Structural and morphological analysis of barium cerate electrolyte for SOFC application
